ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: Approximately 5-10.
10 hours
3h
10 hours
4-5 hours
8 hours
6-9 hours per week
4Hrs
3 hours
10-15 hours
4-5hrs

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The slides are useful, and the content of the course is not that difficult, but the actual lecture is very poor. The textbook is not very good, and several assigned homework questions are unclear.
Good!

It's an okay course, but like almost every biostats course at YSPH, you don't learn much from it unless you teach yourself. The homework assignments aren't bad, but there needs to be an explanation of how to put tables into SAS accurately. That is a big piece of the homework assignments and if you don't get that correct, everything else will be wrong.
The final class where everything was pulled together was good. However throughout the course it sometimes was difficult to put concepts into perspective.
if the professor can teach more systemically and clearly, it would be better
Very good as a categorical analysis class. Learnt a lot! Love it!

Strengths:-Very clear and thorough course material-Nicely organized course structure, applying theoretical material and building on previous lectures-Homework problems related directly to material taught in class-I actually liked the final project. I think it was a nice way to get closure on the course and apply everything I had learned.Weaknesses/Suggestions:-I rented the required text "Categorical Data using SAS" but did not need to open it once. Would not recommend this text to others and definitely not needed for the course.-I found the labs redundant with the lectures and stopped attending after the first week. I would rather have had the professor provide the SAS code related to the lectures and just have the labs be tutorial sessions.
The lectures were well-planned and coherent, but went into much more detail than was necessary to complete the homework assignments. More examples in the lectures would have been helpful.
Helpful course with adequate workload.
good
I learned everything by doing the homework. I could have taught myself the material. In some ways, the course was a waste of time, due to the instruction and structure. The material is important.
Very informative.
honestly, this is a relatively easy class. the explanation for the theory is clear but I think the instructor can teach more in the semester.
Hope there will be more theories. Don't be just simple application.

I think the information was presented in fairly confusing manner, and the language barrier with the professors and the TAs made it a little difficult to really ask questions that required further clarification.

well structured, made sense, very fair amount of homework with helpful class notes and TA notes to work through the problems. Also really liked that the book had answers for odd number homework problems.
This is a good introductory course to categorical data analysis. The course was very well structured and followed the text book. There were no surprises. Clear material and well covered.
Quite useful and need more application to real data during lectures

This was a great course. The homework assignments were very useful for understanding what was being taught in class. The final project was a little long and it would have been good to get a bit more direction. We could have practiced writing the kind of paper that was expected for the final project in homework assignments.

It was useful and practical. It would be better if it was more informative or more in depth. The contents of the course was somehow overlapping with Biostatistics 2 and Applied Analytic Methods in Epidemiology.
helpful, but would be even better if there are more practice on theories

I thought the slides and homework were all helpful in learning the material. The final project however could be improved. It seemed like we were being tested on data cleaning more than what was actually taught in class, by spending hours recoding and figuring out variables, as well as researching an unfamiliar topic. Although this is what real data analysis is like, it was frustrating to have a final project that was so time intensive simply setting up the data set then actually analyzing it as we had learned in class.
COURSE SHOULD BE A MUST-TAKE COURSE. I LEARNED SO MUCH FROM THIS COURSE.
I don't think this class covers as much as other "6" level classes.
This class is very useful. But I hope the instructor can be more engaging.
The primary textbook did not go into detail for many concepts. Supplemental readings would be helpful.
Strenght: excellent power point slides
The course was on interesting material except the instructor was very hard to understand

The course provided the opportunity to learn Categorical Data Analysis with no help from the instructor. Dr. Wang was unable to explain simple concepts in a way that students could understand or appreciate anything. The book was far superior to her methods and eventually served as the only resource for learning the material.
This is a good course whose strengths are its specific contents and evaluation methodology. One weakness is the instructor's lecture delivery style.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Good!

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  An okay instructor, but class wasn't that useful and it took 2 hours to get through 20 slides on average, which is painfully slow. Also very difficult to understand the teacher at times. YSPH needs to hire professors on their ability to teach as well as to research.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr Wang was a sound instructor, but could be improved by engaging more with the examples.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  She taught students in a very well organized way. And I really love the slides she had. Very clear and rich in knowledge.

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr. Wang explained things well and very clearly without reading the slides verbatim. The lectures provided nice examples of topics covered. She was very responsive to emails.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  The instructor responded well to students' questions, but lectures were too detailed.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Organized lectures.Would be better if speak louder.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  good
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Bad. Spoke quietly and read directly off her slides.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Pf. Wang is very knowledgeable about the stuff she teaches.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr. Wang is good, explains the theory clearly.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Great. Nice. Thank you very much.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Solid, interested in the topic, taught it well.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Pleasant and very comprehensive. I had some trouble understanding in class due to voice volume and accent.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Nice teacher
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Dr Wang was a great professor and she was able to explain the concepts very well and gave good examples in class.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  She was very responsible and easy going. Would be better if she could speak louder and make herself more easily understood.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  good and clear

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  INSTRUCTOR WAS FARE IN HOME WORK GRADING AND FINAL PROJECT. SHE TOOK EFFORT INTO LECTURES AND RESPONDED PROMPTLY TO OUR EMAIL QUERIES. i TALKED TO HERE REGARDING PROJECT IN PERSON AND VIA EMAIL. ALWAYS GOT GOOD RESPONSES FROM HER.

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Weaknesses- Read off the slides- was not considerate of students with non biostatics background and concentration- assigned final project with writing component that was not covered in class
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  She is a nice lecturer and explains the principle slowly and clearly
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Lecture notes were easy to follow.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  Very kind and knowledgeable.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  It was difficult to understand Professor Wang and some of the lectures were hard to follow. Classes did not seem to be helpful

Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  The course provided the opportunity to learn Categorical Data Analysis with no help from the instructor. Dr. Wang was unable to explain simple concepts in a way that students could understand or appreciate anything. The book was far superior to her methods and eventually served as the only resource for learning the material.
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  hard to understand
Instructor: Zuoheng Wang  The professor teaching style was somewhat passive or a little lethargic. It would be great if she could be more dynamic while teaching.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  Both TAs were equally bad. The lab sections were a waste of time and did not contribute to understanding of the class. There needs to be a lab section specifically on how to input tables into SAS, which isintegral for homework assignments.

Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  I did not have the opportunity to interact with the TAs much throughout the semester because I stopped attending the lab sessions, finding them redundant with the lectures. I was disappointed that they did not comment on why specific homework answers were wrong (instead of just writing "-1" or "not right") When I asked them directly about this, they deferred me to the professor, who then sent me back to the TAs. A homework answer key for each assignment would have been really helpful in figuring out what I could have done differently.
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  Jiehuan was very patient, and gave very well-planned lectures in the lab sessions.
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  good
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  great
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  Both Jiehuan and Tianqi are great TAs and provided very good explanations for the concepts taught in class.
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  very patient and helpful
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  HE WAS GOOD. ALWAYS SMILING. HE KNOW THE SUBJECT WELL
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  Both teaching fellows were very kind and helpful.
Instructor: Jiehuan Sun  Both TAâs were always willingness to help and opened to any questions.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Good!
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Excellent TA, led the TA session in a very clear way, and care about students.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Organized lectures and timely response to questions.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  good
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Great TA
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Very great.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  very dynamic, good TA
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Enthusiastic and approachable. A little more of a summary of the lecture at the start of lab would be helpful for reinforcement.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Clear thinking, good time management
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  He was very responsible and great.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  They have a lot of knowledge. I learned a lot from them. But it'd be better if they can attend the lectures so that they have a better idea of what has been taught in class.

Instructor: Tianqi Liu  Both TAs provided helpful informational during office hours. The SAS code provided during the lab sessions was helpful. However there wasn't an opportunity to practice on the computers during the lab session.
Instructor: Tianqi Liu  a bit demeaning when students ask questions

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is somewhat useful but is far more frustrating than it needs to be.
Good!
Don't take this class unless you have to. But if you need a biostats credit at a higher level, this is less demanding than some others.
It seems like such a specific topic I am not sure how to apply principles to general PhD work.
I would recommend it because it will teach you very useful and basic categorical analysis methods.
Intro to Categorical Data Analysis gives a complete theoretical and applied review of the topic, one that is basic for most of us studying biostats.
I would recommend it. It provides a good extension of methods presented in the earlier biostatistics courses.
Yes, this course provide important and necessary statistical knowledge.
Take it if you need to learn logistic regression. Otherwise, there are better courses.
Intro course in categorical data analysis. Recommended to first year students.
This is a easy class. Listen to the lecture is enough. If you want to have some statistical exposure after BIS505 and don't want to be tortured by regression analysis, join this class.
No. Because one can teach himself.
Good class, well done with appropriate amount of homework
Yes. The material is very important and the expectations are clear. The workload is reasonable.
it' s not very difficult but worth learning.
Yes, I would recommend this class
I would not likely to strongly recommend it unless it was very necessary for the fellow student.
It is a useful course for practical experience in analyzing categorical data with SAS
I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS COURSE TO STUDENTS
This is a useful and fundamental class in biostatistics. I would recommend it.
This course provides the basics for categorical data analysis.
I would recommend this class.

The course provided the opportunity to learn Categorical Data Analysis withno help from the instructor. Dr. Wang was unable to explain simple concepts in a way that students could understand or appreciate anything. The book was far superior to her methods and eventually served as the only resource for learning the material.
I would tell the student that this is an intermediate course to categorical data analysis and that is recommendable to take the course because its content and evaluation methodology.
